languageKey.label: toctoc_comments plugin configuration options
EXT:toctoc_comments/ext_icon.gif
Plugin options serve to overwrite the options set in general or page Typoscript. Here, in the plugin itself - just make the exceptions work.
Defines operation mode of the plugin
"Normal" mode for use of social network components. "Recent Comments" Displays recent comments list. "Reportbad comment" Displays a form where the user can enter a complaint about a comment.
Number of recent comments shown
Select if to show all comments or just comments attached to specific records
If you select "custom" you can select the concerned extension in the next step. (after the reload of the page).
Custom external prefix for recent comments
The custom external prefix for recent comments triggers specific records like News, Products or other records with associated comments.
List of pages where a record of a contained plugin should be shown

When displaying the recent comments list over all pages in a website, there can be web pages where the plugin is setup without triggering prefix, but in fact the page displays records. If you have setups like this, here you can specify the concerned pages.
:recentcommentsPluginRecords
Associated records to show for the selected pages containing plugins
The list of the records must be sorted according the pages-list.
:recentcommentsPluginpages
Defines a parameter in URL that will trigger comments displaying for records

Defines a parameter in URL that will trigger comments displaying. Typically it is a parameter that defines a single view. For example, tt_news extension uses tx_ttnews[tt_news] as a parameter to define single item to show. Therefore external prefix is tx_ttnews in this case.

To comment on content elements, the "pages" prefix is set automatically in background, you can leave the field blank.
Defines an (optional) content element or record for which comments will be stored. Exclusive with triggering prefix for content elements

You can specify another toctoc_comments plugin with this. If so the comments of the other plugin are displayed, but still you can configure the current plugin as you want. It works for toctoc_comment plugins implemented for comments on pages (default). For toctoc_comment plugins implemented for comments on records it will not work, the prefix-to-table map can be used only in context of the plugin for the external records. And makes no sense, because comments are attached to records and not to a content element.
Defines where to store comment records
Define additional pages where page cache will be dropped when data changes

Additional clear cache pages local are added to the pages specified in TS option additionalCachePages (site wide valid) when you delete, update or insert data with the plugin. This is useful for referenced plugins and for cloned plugins. It's needed as well for plugins used for records when the records are triggered by toctoc_comments on more than 1 page
Defines how many comments to show
Defines a period after which commenting is closed

Period is defined by an integer number followed by suffix. Suffix can be h, m, y or d (meaning hours, months, years or days respectively). Example: 5d (means close commenting after 5 days). If empty, comments can be added at any moment.
Comments need be approved by moderator
If checked, every message will require to be approved by moderator. Moderator will receive an email with comment content and links to approve or delete comment.
If checked, comments will not be approved unless referer matches current site

It is not safe to use this option because many browsers are not reliable in sending referer (and they are not really required to). Also many firewalls block this field. Use only if you are really paranoid about it.
Require captcha to be submitted together with comment.
Example of captcha in the comment form
Defines the email address to which notifications about new unapproved comments are sent.
Defines the email address from which emails are sent.
Use Attachment Feature Webpagepreview
if the Attachment feature Webpagepreview is enabled, then webpagepreviews are shown and users can generate new previews.
Use of Share-Links
Use of Share-Links for social networks like Facebook, Google and Twitter
Share-Link for Facebook is suppressed
Use of Share-Link for Facebook is suppressed. Similar options exist for other social networks
Stop Commenting
Commenting can be totally suppressed, 0 (default) or 1
Enable only ratings
Enable ratings only just displays the rating component of the plugin
Enable ratings

Enables web site visitors to rate comments or records. Notice that ratings change is only available if comments are not closed for the item. When comments are closed, ratings automatically become read-only
Shows voting
Shows the rating stars and enables voting, if checked.
Show vote of user
Shows the vote of the user
Show Like and Dislike
Show Like and Dislike Features, if checked both are active.
Show Dislike Feature
The show Dislike features makes only sense in connection with useLikeDislike.
Select a Webpage preview

Select a Webpage preview that has been created in the frontend and assign it to the plugin. The Webpagepreview will be shown at the top of the plugin. It can be used to illustrate the article people are commenting on.
